org.jcvi.jillion.core.qual

Interface QualitySequence

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<PhredQuality>, Sequence<PhredQuality>

    public interface QualitySequence
extends Sequence<PhredQuality>
    QualitySequence is a marker interface for Sequence implementations that encode PhredQuality values.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Object o)
      Two QualitySequences are equal if they contain the same PhredQualitys in the same order.
      OptionalDouble getAvgQuality()
      Get the average quality score as a double.
      Optional<PhredQuality> getMaxQuality()
      Get the min PhredQuality in the Sequence.
      Optional<PhredQuality> getMinQuality()
      Get the min PhredQuality in the Sequence.
      default Optional<DoubleSummaryStatistics> getSummaryStats()
      Get the Java 8 DoubleSummaryStatistics of all the quality values in this sequence.
      default Optional<DoubleSummaryStatistics> getSummaryStats(Range subRange)
      Get the Java 8 DoubleSummaryStatistics of just the quality values in this sequence within the specified sub Range.
      int hashCode()
      byte[] toArray()
      Create an new array of bytes of length Sequence.getLength() where index in the array is the ith quality score stored as a byte.
      default byte[] toArray(Range range)
      Create an new array of bytes of length Range.getLength() where index in the array is the ith quality score stored as a byte.

      Create a new Builder object that is initialized to the current sequence.

        forEach, iterator, spliterator

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        boolean equals(Object o)
        Two QualitySequences are equal if they contain the same PhredQualitys in the same order.

        Two sequences should be equal if they are both the same length and contain the same elements in the same order.

        Specified by:
        equals in interface Sequence<PhredQuality>
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        Specified by:
        hashCode in interface Sequence<PhredQuality>
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • toArray

        byte[] toArray()
        Create an new array of bytes of length Sequence.getLength() where index in the array is the ith quality score stored as a byte. This method may be expensive to perform depending on the size of the sequence and the encoding used.
        Returns:
        a new byte array, never null.

      • toArray

        default byte[] toArray(Range range)
        Create an new array of bytes of length Range.getLength() where index in the array is the ith quality score stored as a byte. This method may be expensive to perform depending on the size of the sequence and the encoding used.
        Parameters:
        range - the subrange of quality scores to get; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a new byte array, never null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.
        Since:
        5.2

      • getAvgQuality

        OptionalDouble getAvgQuality()
        Get the average quality score as a double. This calculation only works on a sequence that is not empty.
        Returns:
        the avg quality score as a double.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - if the sequence length is 0.

      • getMinQuality

        Optional<PhredQuality> getMinQuality()
        Get the min PhredQuality in the Sequence.
        Returns:
        an Optional PhredQuality that is empty if the sequence is empty.

      • getMaxQuality

        Optional<PhredQuality> getMaxQuality()
        Get the min PhredQuality in the Sequence.
        Returns:
        an Optional PhredQuality that is empty if the sequence is empty.

      • toBuilder

        default QualitySequenceBuilder toBuilder()
        Create a new Builder object that is initialized to the current sequence. Any changes made to the returned Builder will NOT affect this immutable Sequence.
        Specified by:
        toBuilder in interface Sequence<PhredQuality>
        Returns:
        a new Builder instance, will never be null.
        Since:
        5.0

      • getSummaryStats

        default Optional<DoubleSummaryStatistics> getSummaryStats()
        Get the Java 8 DoubleSummaryStatistics of all the quality values in this sequence.
        Returns:
        an Optional which will be empty if the sequence length is 0 or else a non-null DoubleSummaryStatistics.
        Since:
        5.3

      • getSummaryStats

        default Optional<DoubleSummaryStatistics> getSummaryStats(Range subRange)
        Get the Java 8 DoubleSummaryStatistics of just the quality values in this sequence within the specified sub Range.
        Parameters:
        subRange - the subrange
        Returns:
        an Optional which will be empty if the sequence length is 0 or else a non-null DoubleSummaryStatistics.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if range is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if Range contains values outside of the possible sequence offsets.
        Since:
        5.3
